Lyrics: [Verse 1]
How the hell'd we wind up like this?
Why weren't we able, to see the signs that we missed
And try to turn the tables
I wish you'd unclench your fists, and unpack your suitcase
Lately there's been too much of this
But don't think it's too late
[Pre-Chorus]
Nothing's wrong, just as long as you know that someday I will
[Chorus]
Someday, somehow
I'm gonna make it all right, but not right now
I know you're wondering when
(You're the only one who knows that)
Someday, somehow
I'm gonna make it all right, but not right now
I know you're wondering when

That we could end up saying
Things we've always needed to say
So we could end up staying
Now the story's played out like this
Just like a paperback novel
Let's rewrite an ending that fits
Instead of a Hollywood horror

Nothing's wrong, just as long as you know that someday I will

Someday, somehow
I'm gonna make it all right, but not right now

Nothing's wrong, just as long as you know that someday I will
[Chorus]

Comments: The lyrics of “Someday” chronicle a lost promise; the singer talks about how a relationship failed and he wonders “how the hell’d we wind up like this”. He wishes that they could discuss their issues and that the relationship will come back someday, but that someday never comes.
“Someday” has reached #1 (where it stayed for three weeks) in Canada and #7 in the United States.
Yes, a second version of the music video with an alternate ending exists.
Title: Nickelback – Someday Lyrics | Genius Lyrics
